Title: Exploring the OSH Scenario in Floating Solar PV Projects in India and Opportunities for Ergonomics Design Interventions
Abstract summary: The paper explores occupational safety and health issues faced by workers in floating solar PV projects in India and identifies opportunities for ergonomics design interventions.

Title: SUSTAINABLE ERGONOMICS FOR SOLAR INSTALLATIONS
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the occupational safety risks associated with solar installations and the need for sustainable ergonomics research for renewable energy installation and maintenance workers.

Title: The effect of harness suspension on a simulated maintenance task efficacy in the renewable energy industry.
Authors: A. Stewart, M. Gardiner, Jonathan MacDonald, H. Williams
Abstract summary: Suspended harness maintenance tasks are less efficient than seated or standing tasks for renewable energy workers.

Title: Renewable energy and occupational health and safety research directions: a white paper from the Energy Summit, Denver Colorado, April 11-13, 2011.
Authors: K. Mulloy, Steven A. Sumner, Cecile Rose, G. Conway, S. Reynolds, M. Davidson, D. Heidel, P. Layde
Abstract summary: Limited data suggests renewable energy offers worker safety benefits, but more research is needed on occupational hazards in the industry.

Title: Emerging OSH Issues in Installation and Maintenance of Floating Solar Photovoltaic Projects and Their Link with Sustainable Development Goals
Authors: A. Sen, Akshay Shirish Mohankar, Abdulrahman Khamaj, S. Karmakar
Abstract summary: The paper identifies occupational risks and ergonomic design interventions for workers in the floating solar photovoltaic industry.

Title: A cross-sectional survey of musculoskeletal disorder hazard exposures and self-reported discomfort among on-shore wind turbine service technicians
Authors: S. Fischer, Sarah M Koltun, Jessie Lee
Abstract summary: The paper identifies musculoskeletal disorder hazards faced by wind turbine service technicians and suggests incorporating ergonomic principles into wind turbine design to address these hazards.

Title: Keselamatan Dan Kesehatan Kerja Pada Offshore Wind Farm GEO QUIP MARINE Company
Authors: Ilham Okta Pratama, Sri Sundari, Marisi Pakpahan
Venue: Sammajiva: Jurnal Penelitian Bisnis dan Manajemen
Abstract summary: The paper discusses occupational health and safety hazards for workers in the offshore wind power industry, highlighting the need for further research on unique and combined risks.

Title: The Impact of Renewable Energy for Occupational Health in the Smart Grid Era
Authors: S. Gerassis, A. Abad, Eduardo Giráldez, J. Taboada
Abstract summary: Increased renewable energy generation is associated with reduced nervous system diseases for workers in the electric industry.
